pull.title: Enable -Wstring-concatenation and -Wstring-conversion on clang builds
pull.body:
The only current violations are a few uses of assert(!"descriptive string").

Seems the benefit of ensuring against a code fault outweighs the benefit of possible additional information in these cases.

> [-Wstring-concatenation](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/DiagnosticsReference.html#wstring-concatenation)
> Diagnostic text:
>
> warning: suspicious concatenation of string literals in an array initialization; did you mean to separate the elements with a comma?
>
> [-Wstring-conversion](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/DiagnosticsReference.html#id805)
> Diagnostic text:
>
> warning: implicit conversion turns string literal into bool: A to B

https://clang.llvm.org/docs/DiagnosticsReference.html#wstring-concatenation

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#28191](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28191) (refactor: Remove unused MessageStartChars parameters from BlockManager methods by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Concept ACK. This has been open for a while, I'm curious to know if any new violations have snuck in since?

> Concept ACK. This has been open for a while, I'm curious to know if any new violations have snuck in since?

Maybe rebase it?
Thanks! Now mind updating to use `Assert()`? :)

events.message: refactor: Convert string-conversion violation asserts to use Assert from util/check

events.body: Rebased, converted assignments to initialization, and moved to `Assert` where possible. I could not apply `Assert(false)` in interpreter.cpp due to errors, but https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26504 could be applied here once merged.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
ðŸ™ This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).
Closing for now due to lack of progress. Let us know if this should be reopened.

comments.body: Imo it'd be cleaner and more readable to just leave the logic here as before, turning the wonky string assertions into comments.

Not sure what the goal here is? This will print something else on stderr when the assert is hit.

Pretty sure the previous code is commonly used and understood?
